title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act titled "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" allows for the Department of Defense to recognize dependent children of members of the Armed Forces. The Act establishes a lapel button for eligible children of military service members serving on active duty for more than 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will approve the design and establish an application process for eligible children to receive the button upon payment of a fee. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents of members serving on active duty. The presentation of the button is subject to payment of a fee to cover manufacturing and distribution costs. Each eligible child dependent may receive only one button, but if they are dependent on multiple members, they can receive a button for each member. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents of members serving on active duty. Each eligible child dependent may receive a button for each member they are dependent on. If a button is lost or damaged without fault, it can be replaced upon application and payment. The term 'eligible child dependent' is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces as described in specific sections. The Secretary of Defense will issue necessary regulations for implementation. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations for the children of military service members commemorative lapel button, ensuring uniformity across armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will expedite the design, manufacture, and issuance of the children of military service members commemorative lapel button. The button will be retroactively available to anyone who can prove eligibility. The Secretary of Defense will make commemorative lapel buttons available to eligible children of military service members, with an application process in place. Members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, will be notified of this availability. The Secretary of Defense will notify eligible members of the Armed Forces about the availability of a children of military service members commemorative lapel button. Applications must be submitted within one year of the announcement of the button's availability. The Secretary will announce the availability of the lapel button within one year. Costs, limitations, and exceptions apply to the presentation of the button.
